newsitem.title: UK: Major commits govt to UK paedophile, stalking bills.
newsitem.headline: Major commits govt to UK paedophile, stalking bills.

text.p: Prime Minister John Major said on Wednesday he was willing to add two bills, for a register of convicted paedophiles and to make "stalking" a crime, to the government's legislative programme for the session of parliament which began on Wednesday.
Ministers had earlier said that the two bills would have to be taken through parliament as private members' measures if they were to reach the statute book before the next general election.

But Major told parliament that in view of support for the two measures by opposition parties, he would make them government measures, greatly increasing the chances of them passing through parliament.
